articles.author: Ankur Banerjee
articles.description: Asian shares slid to nine-month lows on Thursday, while the dollar was at two-month peak as fears over China's sluggish economic recovery and concerns that the Federal Reserve may still raise interest rates rattled investors.
articles.title: Asian stocks hit 9-month lows on worries over China economy, US rates

articles.author: Tetsushi Kajimoto
articles.description: Japan's exports fell in July for the first time in nearly 2-1/2 years, dragged down by faltering demand for light oil and chip-making equipment, underlining concerns about a global recession as key markets like China weakened.
articles.title: Japan exports fall for first time since 2021, stoking concerns about outlook

articles.author: Wayne Cole
articles.description: Australia employment unexpectedly fell in July to end two months of very strong growth, while the jobless rate ticked higher in a sign the drum-tight labour market might finally be loosening.
articles.title: Australia July jobs take a surprise fall as market loosens

articles.author: Katya Golubkova, Sudarshan Varadhan
articles.description: Oil prices were choppy on Thursday after falling over the past three sessions, with the undertone grim on worries that slowing growth in China and possible further U.S. interest rate hikes will weaken fuel demand in the world's two biggest economies.
articles.title: Oil prices wobble on jitters over China economy, US rates path

articles.author: Howard Schneider, Michael Derby
articles.description: Federal Reserve officials were divided over the need for more interest rate hikes at the U.S. central bank's July 25-26 meeting, with "some participants" citing the risks to the economy of pushing rates too far even as "most" policymakers continued to prioritize the battle against inflation, according to minutes of the session that were released on Wednesday.
articles.title: Fed officials divided in July over need for more rate hikes, minutes show

articles.author: Rae Wee
articles.description: The dollar pushed the yen deeper into intervention territory on Thursday as a resilient U.S. economy underscored the need for higher-for-longer interest rates, while a strikingly ultra-dovish Bank of Japan struggled to defend its policy stance.
articles.title: Dollar shines on US economic resilience; Aussie tumbles after employment data

articles.author: Abhirup Roy
articles.description: Texas on Wednesday approved its plan to require companies to include Tesla's (TSLA.O) technology in electric vehicle (EV) charging stations to be eligible for federal funds, despite calls for more time to re-engineer and test the connectors.
articles.title: Texas approves plan to mandate Tesla tech for EV chargers despite opposition

articles.author: Brendan Pierson
articles.description: A U.S. appeals court ruled on Wednesday to restrict access to the abortion pill mifepristone, partially upholding a lower court ruling that alarmed abortion advocates and pharmaceutical companies.
articles.title: US appeals court rules to restrict abortion pill use

articles.author: Jack Queen
articles.description: A Georgia state law against racketeering could be a powerful tool in prosecuting Donald Trump, but applying charges traditionally used to take down organized crime risks miring the case in legal and logistical complications.
articles.title: Trump Georgia indictment: RICO charges could be a double-edged sword

articles.author: Moira Warburton
articles.description: A campaign aide to embattled Republican U.S. Representative George Santos was charged with identity theft and wire fraud in federal court for impersonating a top congressional staffer in fundraising appeals, court documents unsealed on Wednesday showed.
articles.title: Santos aide charged with fraud for impersonating top congressional aide
